title: How China Is Using AI to Rewire Its Energy System as Power Becomes the Biggest Constraint on Artificial Intelligence
description: In the city of Chifeng, in northern China’s Inner Mongolia region, Reuters reports an ultra-modern factory humming to life not on coal or gas, but on wind, solar power, and algorithms. Owned by green-energy company Envision, the facility produces hydrogen and ammonia using renewable electricity, guided by an artificial intelligence system designed to solve one [...]The post How China Is Using AI to Rewire Its Energy System as Power Becomes the Biggest Constraint on Artificial Intelligence appeared first on Tekedia.

title: AI Drives 90% of US GDP Growth in 2025, Raising Recession Risks
description: The U.S. economy in 2025 relies heavily on AI investments, which drove over 90% of GDP growth amid stagnation in other sectors. This dependency echoes past bubbles, with risks of overleveraging, debt, and labor disruptions. Experts warn that a slowdown could trigger recession, urging diversification for stability.

title: Brand & AI Safety Summit Series Expands To Dubai, Channel Factory Joins Launch As Initial Title Partner

title: Tesla Analyst Predicts $3 Trillion Market Cap by 2026 on AI Pivot
description: Dan Ives of Wedbush Securities predicts Tesla could hit a $3 trillion market cap by 2026, driven by its AI pivot in autonomy, robotics, and regulatory easing. He emphasizes Tesla's data moat and revenue potential, despite critics highlighting delays and competition. This forecast underscores Tesla's evolving role as an AI powerhouse.

title: Meta’s Mango AI Targets Video Generation Dominance by 2026
description: Meta is developing AI models like "Mango" for advanced video generation, set for 2026 release, to challenge Google and OpenAI's dominance in generative AI. Amid talent wars and ethical concerns, this shift from open-source aims to enhance social platforms. The rivalry promises transformative content creation innovations.
